result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Letter dated 10/17/2022, filed by Atty Herbers, requesting a Plea/Sentencing date

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/19/2022 - Schedule for Plea/Sentencing.**
Signed by Judge Carter on 10/17/2022.

11:09 AM Defendant Jeremy J Bachmeier in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. appeared by video for Jeremy J Bachmeier.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for bail/bond hearing. 

Defense makes arguments in support of request for bail condition modification for the Defendant to have contact with the victim. 
Victim makes statements. 
State makes arguments in opposition to any bail modification. 

For reasons stated on the record, the court will deny the motion for bail modification and set for a jury trial and status. 10/19/2020 hearing date is off.
Jury status hearing scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on November 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on November 10, 2022 at 10:30 am.

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 10/12/2022 - Approved.**

Bail/bond hearing on October 4, 2022 at 09:30 am.
filed by Atty Herbers

Motion to Modify Bail, filed by Atty Herbers

**Reviewed by Judge Carter on 09/23/2022 - Okay to schedule**

9:06 AM Defendant Jeremy J Bachmeier in court, in custody.  Attorney J Andrew Herbers Jr. in court for Jeremy J Bachmeier.  Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M Jay in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Case called for bail modification motion hearing. 

Defense makes argument in support of request to modify bail to amend to a signature bond or grant huber bailee status. Defense indicates that the Defendant is being revoked by the DOC, has waived hearing, and will likely be in custody on that case until March. 
Victim A makes statements. 
State makes arguments in opposition to any bail modification. 

For reasons stated on the record, the court will deny the Motion for bail modification. 

Defense is awaiting possible new charges, and then a global offer from the State. Discovery on this case has been received, other than a surveillance video.
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
